• Pride

For the murder to occur, the murderer and Mr. Boddy must have been alone in a room with at least one weapon at some point in the night. Any clue about Mr. Boddy's whereabouts should be read as "Mr. Boddy (dead or alive) ..."

- The Rope was in the room just east of Mr. Boddy at 12:00 AM

A. Who murdered Mr. Boddy?
B. What weapon did the murderer use?
C. Where was the murder committed?
D. When did the murder occur?
E. Why did the murderer do it?

And the following bonus question(s):



Fill out your final answers in the following format:

B. WEAPON
C. ROOM
D. TIME
E. MOTIVE

The following persons of interest have been identified as suspects:

• Miss Scarlet
• Monsieur Brunette
• Mrs. White
• Miss Peach
• Sgt. Gray
• Mr. Green
• Professor Plum
• Mrs. Peacock
• Madame Rose

And the following weapons were found on the premises:

• Poison
• Knife
• Lead Pipe
• Wrench
• Revolver
• Candlestick
• Rope
• Horseshoe

The murder could only have occured in one of the following rooms:

01. Cloak Room
02. Fountain
03. Dining Room
04. Conservatory
05. Lounge
06. Kitchen
07. Courtyard
08. Hall
09. Ballroom
10. Study
11. Studio
12. Drawing Room

The rooms are laid out as follows:

  NN NN NN  
W 01|02|03 E
W 04|05|06 E
W 07|08|09 E
W 10|11|12 E
  SS SS SS  

For the murder to occur, the murderer and Mr. Boddy must have been alone in a room with at least one weapon.

The available clues are as follows:

- The Knife was in the Courtyard
- Madame Rose was in the Ballroom
- The Horseshoe was in the room just east of Mr. Green
- Mrs. White was at the Fountain or Miss Peach was in the Studio
- The Rope was in the Drawing Room
- Mrs. Peacock was at the Fountain
- Professor Plum was in the Courtyard or Sgt. Gray was in the Cloak Room
- Madame Rose was in the Ballroom if and only if the Wrench was in the Study
- Miss Peach was in the Lounge
- The Revolver was in the Hall or Professor Plum was in the Cloak Room
- Mrs. White was in the same room as Monsieur Brunette
- Mr. Green was in the Study if and only if the Revolver was in the Drawing Room
- The Candlestick was in the Kitchen
- Miss Scarlet was at the Fountain
- The Lead Pipe was in the same room as Mr. Green
- The Horseshoe was in the Studio or Mrs. Peacock was in the Kitchen
- Mr. Boddy was murdered by Madame Rose

Please answer the following question(s):

A. What weapon did the murderer use?
B. Where was the murder committed?

And the following bonus question(s):

C. Where was Professor Plum?
D. Where was Monsieur Brunette?
E. Where was Mr. Green?
F. Where was the Poison?
G. Where was the Horseshoe?

Fill out your final answers in the following format:

A. WEAPON
B. ROOM
C. ROOM
D. ROOM
E. ROOM
F. ROOM
G. ROOM

The following persons of interest have been identified as suspects:

• Professor Plum
• Mrs. White
• Mrs. Peacock

And the following weapons were found on the premises:

• Knife
• Horseshoe

The murder could only have occured in one of the following rooms:

1. Study
2. Fountain
3. Hall
4. Courtyard

The rooms are laid out as follows:

  N N  
W 1|2 E
W 3|4 E
  S S  

The exact time of the murder is a bit uncertain, but it has been narrowed down to one of the following times:

• 11:00 PM
• 12:00 AM

At every time the suspects and Mr. Boddy either stayed in their current room or moved to an orthogonally adjacent room (north, south, east, or west). Weapons could be moved by suspects between rooms as well.

Each suspect had one of the following possible motives for killing Mr. Boddy:

• Betrayal (1 suspect)
• Fear (2 suspects)

For the murder to occur, the murderer and Mr. Boddy must have been alone in a room with at least one weapon at some point in the night. Any clue about Mr. Boddy's whereabouts should be read as "Mr. Boddy (dead or alive) ..."

The available clues are as follows:

- Mrs. Peacock moved from the Fountain to the Study at 12:00 AM
- Mrs. Peacock was in the room just west of the Knife at 12:00 AM
- Mrs. White moved from the Hall to the Courtyard at 12:00 AM
- Mr. Boddy was in the same room as the Horseshoe at 12:00 AM
- Mrs. White was in the same room as Professor Plum at 12:00 AM
- Mr. Boddy was killed with the Knife
- Professor Plum is motivated by Fear
- A suspect motivated by Fear was in the Hall at 11:00 PM if and only if the suspect motivated by Betrayal was in the Hall at 11:00 PM

Please answer the following question(s):

A. Who murdered Mr. Boddy?
B. Where was the murder committed?
C. When did the murder occur?
D. Why did the murderer do it?

And the following bonus question(s):

E. Where was the suspect motivated by Betrayal at 12:00 AM?
F. Where was the suspect motivated by Betrayal at 11:00 PM?
G. What motivates Mrs. Peacock?

Fill out your final answers in the following format:

A. SUSPECT
B. ROOM
C. TIME
D. MOTIVE
E. ROOM
F. ROOM
G. MOTIVE
